questions.question: ………………… Delhi was without electricity last night.
………………….. my friends wished me on my birthday.
...................... her income come from the estate.
questions.description: Before a noun with a determiner (the, my, his, this), both half and half of are possible.

questions.question: There are trees on …………………. side of the path.
questions.description: Before a singular noun, we use 'each'.

questions.question: She had a child holding on to …………………. hand.
………………… people agree with me.
questions.description: We use 'most' before a noun without a determiner.

questions.question: Can I ask ……………….. questions?
questions.description: Few has a negative meaning. It means 'almost none'. To mean 'some' we use 'a few'.

questions.question: ..................... key opens the door.
questions.description: We use 'neither' before a noun without a determiner.
